thread.title: Some Puyallup city workers given policing powers
thread.title_full: Some Puyallup city workers given policing powers | www.kirotv.com

author: kirotv.com
title: Some Puyallup city workers given policing powers
text:
Despite concerns from the community, Puyallup leaders unanimously approved a plan to give some city workers policing powers.
The new policy will allow city workers to issue trespass tickets to anyone acting unsafe or disruptive on city property.
They can also ban troublemakers from coming back for 45 days.
In July, opponents argued the policy targets the homeless.
“What does a homeless person supposed to do if they’re banned? If you’re homeless, you’re illegal in Puyallup,” said a person who attended a city council meeting.
“This is not based on status of human beings’ station in life. It is based on conduct,” said Puyallup City Manager Kevin Yamamoto.
The policy was introduced after an unruly woman attacked a Puyallup librarian last year.
The News Tribune reports that anyone who has the power to issue trespass tickets will be trained first.
